channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Feel-Good Neurotransmitter’ Dopamine May Improve Memory Of Alzheimer’s Patients, Study Suggests
item.description: Mice given a treatment to boost dopamine levels for three months had better memory than those that weren’t given the drug.

item.title: The challenge of “a risky scheme”
item.description: New ideas aren’t adopted all at once. A few people go first while the rest of us watch to see how it goes. “Look, Mikey, he likes it!” This is the story of tech innovations, dance crazes and even food. Ideas spread horizontally, and people who prefer the status quo will embrace an idea only […]

item.title: VP Pick Walz’s Healthcare Policies Align With Harris
item.description: From abortion rights to healthcare affordability to medical debt, Walz has sought to do at the state level what Harris aims to accomplish federally.

item.title: Learning in August
item.description: What better time? An hour a day for a month and you can learn a skill you’ll have forever. Beach reads are a fine way to chill out, but a month spent to learn a skill is a fine way to take advantage of a quiet time. My brand new course on Strategy is now […]

item.title: Dolce & Gabbana Debuts $108 Dog Perfume With ‘Woody Creamy’ Undertones
item.description: Fashion house Dolce & Gabbana wants pampered pups to smell like ylang-ylang and sandalwood with Fefé, a new luxury fragrance mist designed especially for dogs.

item.title: Reclaiming “fiasco”
item.description: Usually modified with “total,” the failure might not be as bad as we fear. The origin of the word probably comes from Italian, a long time ago. The person who loses a round in a game has to buy the next bottle for the group (from: flask). Which means that there is going to be […]

item.title: Californians Are Buying More EVs Than Ever From Rivian And Ford, But Fewer From Tesla
item.description: Governor Gavin Newsom said about 26% of new vehicle sales in the state were battery, plug-in and fuel cell electric in the second quarter, more than triple the national average.

item.title: The Mississippi River paradox
item.description: There’s no water in that river that was there ten years ago. The boundaries have shifted in that time as well, there’s no riverbank that’s exactly where it was. And the silt and the fish have all moved too. So, what’s “the Mississippi River”? It’s a label, a placeholder, and a marker–when the Mississippi does […]

item.title: Tech Experts Share Tested And Effective Data Minimization Strategies
item.description: Organizations are exploring data minimization that’s focused not only on reducing the volume of data they hold, but also on collecting less new data going forward.

item.title: Infamy
item.description: We’ve gotten so hung up on famous that it’s easy to forget that there are two kinds of renown. Being known for lowering the standards of discourse, cheating, or whining is a choice, but why would you trade your reputation to become infamous?
